intro: Petalostemon carneus var. albidus, commonly known as the white-flowered petalostemon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink petals that are often arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers typically bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
